release.action: Random Walk plugin reported bad seed colors. It was not a bug but rather lack of proper documentation.
Fixed problem with FormatConverter.
Included javac dependency to solve problem with dependencies removed from Fiji. See this thread: http://forum.imagej.net/t/no-javac-jar-found/2340.
Added simple tool for conversion between paQP and QCONF format.
Protrusion Analysis: Added outline plots.
Protrusion Analysis: Added averaged background images.
Protrusion Analysis: Added export of statistics.
Protruision Analysis: Added user interface.
Protrusion Tracking: New output images.
Plugin code reworked.
paQP files generated from QCONF contained bad segementation parameters.
ANA: clear option does not work.
ANA: stored bad paths in QCONF.
Added description of parameters in paQP file.
Rename toolbar menu entry.
Add preselection of active file format.
Protrusion Tracking: New output images.
Deal with problem of restoring image from QCONF file.
Fix of several bugs introduced after issue 196.
Detect whether loaded QCONF file contains any previous data and notify user if it does.
Option for saving outlines as separte image in ANA module.
Allow to load new format to ANA.
Data files in old format (Q111) are always generated when saving in new format (QCONF).
Loading QCONF causes massive exceptions
Add options to clear all snakes and other settings from BOA menu
Allow to load new format to ECMM
Add support of new format QCONF to Q Analysis plugin
Current frame sometimes does not update when action taken in Binary Segmentation plugin.
Binary Segmentation causes errors when snake is modified.
BOA does not ask about file to save on SaveQuit.
Loading QCONF causes massive exceptions sometimes.
Edited snakes are not processed by filters.
Add default log4j configuration file.
Binary segmentation window can be duplicated.
Add about menu in QuimP bar.
Add link to doc from QuimP bar.
Random Walk GUI should offer option of creating of seed image.
BinarySegmentation fails on single slice images.
Binary segmentation should use various sources of masks.
